greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of partitions of n into odd divisors of n.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
formula: a(n) = f(n,n,1) with f(n,m,k) = if k<=m then f(n,m,k+2)+f(n,m-k,k)*0^(n mod k) else 0^m.
maple: a:= proc(n) option remember; local b, l; l, b:= sort(
mathematica: a[0] = 1; a[n_] := a[n] = Module[{b, l}, l = Select[Divisors[n], OddQ]; b[m_, i_] := b[m, i] = If[m == 0, 1, If[i < 1, 0, b[m, i-1] + If[l[[i]] > m, 0, b[m - l[[i]], i]]]]; b[n, Length[l]]];
Table[a[n], {n, 0, 100}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Apr 11 2017, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Dec 11 2009
